lexUnit.name: survive.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: continue to live or exist in spite of (an accident or ordeal).

sentence.text: Some groups may survive the winter , once the old people have died off .
If ice did not float , pond life would not survive the winter , which means that life itself would not have survived in our climate .
Adults are not frost-tolerant ; only eggs ( and possibly larvae ) survive the winter .

It was also a source of fees for more distant associates and although such relationships were more vulnerable to dynastic change , because less bound up with the territorial dominance of the lord of Middleham , some did nevertheless survive the transfer of power in 1471 .
Doctor McRae , the only one to have survived the cruise unscathed , has tripped on a kerbstone and broken his foot .
This provided Railfreight with valuable contracts for long-distance bulk coil traffic , traffic which would not have materialised if the steel industry had survived the 1980s unscathed .
He had survived six previous attempts on his life .

To distort reality further , large or bright or moving or repeating or noisy objects attract more attention and are more likely to survive our filtering than small , dull , stationary , non-recurring or quiet objects .
It survived the Great Fire intact and between 1621 and 1638 was the headquarters of the East India Company .
They are part of the legend , of course ; you and I would n't survive it . ''
No one knows how Franklin survived his experiment with lightning .

But somehow the little orphan survived the ordeal , as she also later survived the farce of being crated up and flown to the Mara game reserve when still only six months old , to be shown to the Pope .
THE sister of missing estate agent Suzy Lamplugh told last night how she survived a knife ordeal because of what she had learned from the family 's nightmare .
You were damn lucky if you survived the ordeal .
Do you think Mubarak , and some of what are described as the moderate leaders in the region , will survive the war long-term ?
` Did you know only sixty per cent of Poles with university degrees survived the war ? ''

It was located in a small row of old houses which had survived the war but had little else to say for themselves , being architecturally dull and pressed in on all sides by towering new office blocks and shopping developments .
Two younger brothers did not survive infancy .
He married Mary Green in 1654 , and had seven children , three of whom ( two sons and one daughter ) survived infancy .
She had borne James three children in the last five years , but none had survived infancy , and she accused him regularly of not trying enough to save them .
